question: Which neurotransmitter is most commonly released by pre-ganglionic sympathetic neurons?

A 30-year-old man reported to the emergency department with a complaint of a dog bite on the right arm. The casualty is conscious but the wound is bleeding. No previous medical or surgical history is reported. After history taking, what is the first step of management?

answers.option: Washing and debridement of the wound

question: Which of the following is an indolamine derived from tryptophan?

High voltage, low frequency EEG activity

question: Damage to which of the following results in the loss of pain sensation?

answers.option: Crude touch and two point discrimination
Proprioception, two point discrimination, and vibration

question: L-DOPA is converted to dopamine by which of the following enzymes?

answers.option: Dorsal white column on right side
Dorsal white columns on both sides
Dorsal white column on left side

question: A 21-year-old male got into an accident after which he could not move his body, except for the head, and the weak shrugging of the shoulders. He also lost all senses below the neck level. At which of the following levels is the lesion most likely to have occurred?

A person had an accident after which he is unable to move his body, except for his head, and the weak shrugging of the shoulders. He has also lost all his senses including light touch, pain, and temperature senses below the neck level, and is now unable to perceive his position in space. Squamous part of the temporal lobe

answers.option: A 17-carbon amino alcohol with unsaturated hydrocarbon chain
A 18-carbon amino alcohol with unsaturated hydrocarbon chain
A 18-carbon amino alcohol with saturated hydrocarbon chain

question: Which of the following correctly describes the blood-brain barrier?

answers.option: It is found in peripheral nervous system
Prevents accumulation of potentially hazardous chemicals inside CNS
Assists accumulation of potentially hazardous chemicals inside CNS

It is a freely permeable region
